Posted By: OpeeFomenom (8/9/2010 9:32:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I got one of these in the Onslaught prerelease, and it won me a good few games. Obviously it's not much use outside of a beast tribal deck (or at least a deck with enough large beasts to make sure you can get one out), but if that's what you're playing, it's an absolutely first rate way to force combat damage through. Also good in decks with fading beasts such as [Skyshroud Ridgeback](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyshroud Ridgeback) and [Blastoderm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blastoderm), and any beast-oriented deck with [Ravenous Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ravenous Baloth), since then you won't care too much about losing your own creature.
posts.html:
I got one of these in the Onslaught prerelease, and it won me a good few games. Obviously it's not much use outside of a beast tribal deck (or at least a deck with enough large beasts to make sure you can get one out), but if that's what you're playing, it's an absolutely first rate way to force combat damage through. Also good in decks with fading beasts such as Skyshroud Ridgeback and Blastoderm, and any beast-oriented deck with Ravenous Baloth, since then you won't care too much about losing your own creature.

Posted By: Arglypuff (6/22/2010 12:16:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A very improved [Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arena) for beast decks.   
First of all, it can produce mana which increases its use by far. It becomes part of your mana base and does its job even if you don't have the right creatures or mana to activate it right now.  
Secondly, *you* choose the opponent's creature. Makes the duel between those creatures a lot more interesting ;)  
In the third place comes the activation cost, which is a bit harder but also cheaper to activate. But at least when you're just running RG that's usually preferable to ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol). I'd run at least a single [Mossfire Valley](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mossfire Valley) with it since this helps activating the ability if you draw multiple Cliffs (yet keep in mind having just Valleys sucks even more. But they also find use with [Skarrg, the Rage Pits](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skarrg, the Rage Pits) and [Fire-Lit Thicket](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fire-Lit Thicket) for that matter.)  
  
You might don't want to splash red for it in your monogreen beast deck, but trust me i'ts worth it, even if just for this land.... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

In the third place comes the activation cost, which is a bit harder but also cheaper to activate. But at least when you're just running RG that's usually preferable to .
